H0.text: Photosynthesis is the process whose products are required for cellular respiration, and whose reverse process, cellular respiration, produces products required for photosynthesis.

H1.text: Digestion is the process whose products are required for cellular respiration, and whose products are also required for digestion.

H2.text: Spermatogenesis is the process whose products are needed for cellular respiration, and vice versa.

H3.text: Circulation is the process that supplies oxygen and nutrients required for cellular respiration, and removes the waste products of respiration.

A4.text: When needing to use this stored energy, an organism's cells then metabolize the organic compounds through cellular respiration.

A5.text: Photosynthesis plays a critical role in producing and maintaining the oxygen content of the Earth's atmosphere, and it supplies most of the biological energy necessary for complex life on Earth.
